CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1959, pg. 5, reads: "Carver Day Proclamation - Seen at the ceremony where mayor David L. Lawrence (right, seated), officially proclaimed Jan. 5 as George Washington Carver Day are (seated, left to right), Mrs. Alma Illery and Edward Smith. (Standing: Mrs. Rose L. Smith, Fifth Ave. High School principal, mother of Edward; Mrs. Elaine Gibson, Mrs. W. C. Eichenlaub and Mrs. W. J. Moncrief, all of the National Achievement Clubs (NAC) of which Mrs. Illery is president and founder. The NAC annually sponsors Carver Day. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, standing from left: Fifth Avenue High School principal Rose L. Smith, Elaine Gibson, Mrs. W. C. Eichenlaub, and Mrs. W. J. Moncrief; seated: president and founder of National Achievement Club Alma Illery, Edward Smith, and Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence proclaiming January 5 as George Washington Carver Day, in Office of the Mayor, City County Building
